page.title: 04SOME BIRDS OF OUR DISTRICT
page.content: THE COUNTRY SIDE AROUND NEWTON VILLAGE IS MAINLY GRASSY HILLS,A FEW TREES, SOME SWAMPY GROUND & PONDS. SOME OF ITS PONDS ARE DISUSED MINE SHAFTS,RELICS OF THE TIME WHEN THE BEST IRON ORE IN THE WORLD WAS MINED IN THIS AREA. SOMETIMES YOU FIND LUMPS OF ORE AROUND THE OLD SHAFTS & SPOIL HEAPS . THE BIRDS YOU SEE REGULARLY ARE NOT UNUSUAL OR RARE.IN THE FIELDS & ON THE GRASSY HILLSIDES KESTRELS HUNT, LAPWINGS,ROOKS,JACKDAWS & HERRING-GULLS FOLLOW THE FARMER WHEN HE PLOUGHS.THE GULLS ARE FROM THE WALNEY ISLAND GULLERY THE LARGEST BREEDING COLONY IN EUROPE.IN THE SUMMER TIME SWIFTS,SWALLOWS & HOUSE MARTINS SKIM THROUGH THE AIR.THE OLD MINE BUILDINGS & BARNS ARE WHERE THESE BIRDS NEST.IN SOME CASES THE MINE
